text.section: In this section, "vaccine" means a product intended to elicit, in humans, active or passive immunity against an infectious agent or product of an infectious agent.
There is a Statewide Advisory Commission on Immunizations.
The Secretary shall appoint the membership of the Commission, based on the recommendation of the appropriate medical society or agency.

section.section: The Secretary, in consultation with MedChi, The Maryland State Medical Society, shall appoint the chair of the Commission.

The chair of the Commission shall:
Establish subcommittees to facilitate the work of the Commission; and
Appoint subcommittee chairs from among the Commission members.
The term of an appointed member is 3 years.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may be appointed for more than one term.
The terms of the members of the Commission are staggered as required by the terms provided for the members of the Commission on June 1, 2010.

text.section: A member of the Commission may not receive compensation but is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
The Department shall provide the staffing for the Commission.
The Commission may recommend to the Department that information on vaccine safety be communicated to health care providers.

On or before December 15 of each year, the Commission shall submit a report on its findings and recommendations to the Governor and, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, to the Senate Education, Health, and Environmental Affairs Committee and the House Health and Government Operations Committee.
